\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{$3 \times 3$ lemma from \cite{nakaokaExtriangulatedCategoriesHovey2019}}
	
	\begin{theorem}
		Any commutative square consists of two parallel $\mathbb E$-inflations and $\mathbb E$-deflations completes to the following diagram
\begin{equation*}
	% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, sep = scriptsize]
	{A_1} \& {A_2} \& {A_3} \& {\,} \\
	{B_1} \& {B_2} \& {B_3} \& {\,} \\
	\& {C_2} \& {C_3} \\
	{\,} \& {\,} \& {\,}
	\arrow["{f_A}", from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow["{i_1}", dashed, from=1-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow["{g_A}", from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow["{i_2}", from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["\circlearrowright"{description}, draw=none, from=1-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{\delta_A}", dashed, from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow["{i_3}", from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{f_B}", from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{g_B}", from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{p_2}", from=2-2, to=3-2]
	\arrow["{\delta_B}", dashed, from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["{p_3}", from=2-3, to=3-3]
	\arrow["{g_C}", dashed, from=3-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon _2}", dashed, from=3-2, to=4-2]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon _3}", dashed, from=3-3, to=4-3]
\end{tikzcd},
\end{equation*}
such that $(i_1;i_2;i_3)$ and $(g_A;g_B;g_C)$ are morphisms of $\mathbb E$-conflations, $i_1$ is a retract of an $\mathbb E$-inflation and $g_C$ is a retract of an $\mathbb E$-deflation.
\begin{itemize}
	\item This completion always exists iff WIC holds.
\end{itemize}
	\end{theorem}
\end{frame}

\subsection{Snake Lemmas}
\frametitle{Weak snake lemma}
\begin{frame}
	\begin{example}[Weak snake lemma]
		Let $f$ and $g$ be composable morphisms that are both $\mathbb E$-inflations and $\mathbb E$-deflations. Then there is a way to find dashed arrows
{\small	\begin{equation*}
		% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, column sep=2em,
    /tikz/column 1/.style={ column sep=1.5em },
    /tikz/column 4/.style={ column sep=1.5em }]
	\& {K_g} \&\& {C_f} \\
	{K_{gf}} \& \square \& Y \& \square \& {C_{gf}} \\
	\& X \&\& Z \\
	{K_f} \&\&\&\& {C_g}
	\arrow["c", curve={height=-18pt}, dashed, from=1-2, to=1-4]
	\arrow["k", from=1-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["d", dashed, from=1-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow["b", dashed, from=2-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow["j", from=2-1, to=3-2]
	\arrow["p", from=2-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow["g", from=2-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow["e", curve={height=-18pt}, dashed, from=2-5, to=4-5]
	\arrow["f", from=3-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["gf", curve={height=24pt}, from=3-2, to=3-4]
	\arrow["q", from=3-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow["r", from=3-4, to=4-5]
	\arrow["a", curve={height=-18pt}, dashed, from=4-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow["i", from=4-1, to=3-2]
\end{tikzcd},
	\end{equation*}}
	such that $\square$ are homotopic squares, and any three terms in $K_F \xrightarrow{a} K_{gf} \xrightarrow{b} K_g \xrightarrow{c} C_f \xrightarrow{d} C_{gf} \xrightarrow{e} C_g$ form $\mathbb E$-conflations.
	\end{example}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Back to Homotopic Squares}
	\begin{proposition}\label{prop:hs-inde-ef}
		Suppose we have a homotopic square between two $\mathbb E$-conflations:
		\begin{equation*}
			% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&]
	K \& X \& Y \& {\,} \\
	K \& A \& B \& {\,}
	\arrow["i", from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow[equals, from=1-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow["f", from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow["u", from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{\boxed{\scriptstyle j_\ast \delta}}"{description}, draw=none, from=1-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["\delta", dashed, from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow["v", from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow["j", from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow["g"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking}, from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon }", dashed, from=2-3, to=2-4]
\end{tikzcd}.
		\end{equation*}
		If and only $f$ is an $\mathbb E$-inflation ($\mathbb E$-deflation), then is $g$. If $f$ is both an $\mathbb E$-inflation and an $\mathbb E$-deflation, we have
		\begin{equation*}
			% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&]
	K \& X \& Y \& C \& {\,} \\
	K \& A \& B \& C \& {\,}
	\arrow["i", dashed, from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow[equals, dashed, from=1-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow["f", from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow["u", from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{\boxed{\scriptstyle q^\ast\eta}}"{description}, draw=none, from=1-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["p", from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow["v", from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow["\eta", dashed, from=1-4, to=1-5]
	\arrow[equals, from=1-4, to=2-4]
	\arrow["j", dashed, from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow["g"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking}, from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["q", from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["\kappa", dashed, from=2-4, to=2-5]
\end{tikzcd},
		\end{equation*}
		such that $j_\ast \delta = q^\ast \eta$.
	\end{proposition}
	The proof is not straightforward, but needs a careful verification.
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}
	\vspace{-1cm}
	\begin{theorem}[Snake lemma]
		Let $(\alpha; \beta; \gamma)$ be a homotopic morphism of $\mathbb E$-conflations, where $\alpha$, $\beta$, and $\gamma$ are all $\mathbb E$-inflations and $\mathbb E$-deflations. We have
				\vspace{-3mm}
\begin{equation*}
	% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, sep = scriptsize]
	\&\& {K_\alpha} \& {K_\beta} \& {K_\gamma} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}{{K_\beta}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}{{K_\gamma}} \\
	\textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}{X} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}{Y} \& X \& Y \& Z \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}{Y} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}{E} \\
	\textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}{L} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}{E} \& L \& E \& Z \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}{E} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}{Z} \\
	\textcolor{rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}{E} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}{M} \& L \& M \& N \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}{M} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}{N} \\
	\textcolor{rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}{{C_\alpha}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}{{C_\beta}} \& {C_\alpha} \& {C_\beta} \& {C_\gamma}
	\arrow["{f'}", from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow["{i_A}"', from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{g'}", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=1-4, to=1-5]
	\arrow["{i_B}"', color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=1-4, to=2-4]
	\arrow["{i_C}"', from=1-5, to=2-5]
	\arrow["x", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, curve={height=-60pt}, dashed, no head, from=1-5, to=3-4]
	\arrow["{g'}", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=1-6, to=1-7]
	\arrow["{i_\beta}"', color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=1-6, to=2-6]
	\arrow["\square"{description}, draw=none, from=1-6, to=2-7]
	\arrow["{i_C}", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=1-7, to=2-7]
	\arrow["f", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow["\alpha"', color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=2-1, to=3-1]
	\arrow["\square"{description}, draw=none, from=2-1, to=3-2]
	\arrow["{\beta_1}"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}, from=2-2, to=3-2]
	\arrow["f", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["\alpha", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=2-3, to=3-3]
	\arrow["g", from=2-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow["{\beta_1}"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}, from=2-4, to=3-4]
	\arrow["\delta"{pos=0.3}, between={0}{0.7}, dashed, from=2-5, to=2-6]
	\arrow[equals, from=2-5, to=3-5]
	\arrow["{\beta_1}"'{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}, from=2-6, to=2-7]
	\arrow["s"', color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=3-1, to=3-2]
	\arrow["s", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=3-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow[equals, from=3-3, to=4-3]
	\arrow["t"', color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=3-4, to=3-5]
	\arrow["{\beta_2}"'{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}, from=3-4, to=4-4]
	\arrow["y"', color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, curve={height=60pt}, dashed, from=3-4, to=5-3]
	\arrow["\gamma"', color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=3-5, to=4-5]
	\arrow["t", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=3-6, to=3-7]
	\arrow["{\beta_2}"'{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}, from=3-6, to=4-6]
	\arrow["\square"{description}, draw=none, from=3-6, to=4-7]
	\arrow["\gamma", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=3-7, to=4-7]
	\arrow["{\beta_2}"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,133;green,51;blue,255}, from=4-1, to=4-2]
	\arrow["y"', color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=4-1, to=5-1]
	\arrow["\square"{description}, draw=none, from=4-1, to=5-2]
	\arrow["{p_\beta}", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=4-2, to=5-2]
	\arrow["u"', from=4-3, to=4-4]
	\arrow["{p_A}", from=4-3, to=5-3]
	\arrow["v"', color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=4-4, to=4-5]
	\arrow["{p_B}", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=4-4, to=5-4]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon }"'{pos=0.3}, between={0}{0.7}, dashed, from=4-5, to=4-6]
	\arrow["{p_C}", from=4-5, to=5-5]
	\arrow["v"', color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=4-6, to=4-7]
	\arrow["{u'}"', color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=5-1, to=5-2]
	\arrow["{u'}"', color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=5-3, to=5-4]
	\arrow["{v'}"', from=5-4, to=5-5]
\end{tikzcd}
\end{equation*}
		consisting of $4$ homotopic squares and a $6$-term chain map
		\begin{equation*}
			K_\alpha \xrightarrow{f'} K_\beta \xrightarrow{g'} K_\gamma \xrightarrow{yx} C_\alpha \xrightarrow{u'} C_\beta \xrightarrow{v'} C_\gamma
		\end{equation*}
		where any two consecutive morphisms form an $\mathbb E$-conflation.
	\end{theorem}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Snake Lemma: Proof Sketch}
	We decompose $(\alpha; \beta; \gamma)$ into 
\begin{equation*}
	% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, sep = scriptsize]
	{K_\alpha} \& {K_\alpha} \&\&\& L \& E \& Z \& {\,} \\
	X \& Y \& Z \& {\,} \& L \& M \& N \& {\,} \\
	L \& E \& Z \& {\,} \&\& {C_\gamma} \& {C_\gamma} \\
	{\,} \& {\,} \&\&\&\& {\,} \& {\,}
	\arrow[equals, from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow["{i_\alpha}", from=1-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow["{fi_\alpha}", from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["s", from=1-5, to=1-6]
	\arrow[equals, from=1-5, to=2-5]
	\arrow["t", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=1-6, to=1-7]
	\arrow["{\beta_2}"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=1-6, to=2-6]
	\arrow["\square"{description}, draw=none, from=1-6, to=2-7]
	\arrow["\kappa", dashed, from=1-7, to=1-8]
	\arrow["\gamma", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=1-7, to=2-7]
	\arrow["f", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow["\alpha", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=2-1, to=3-1]
	\arrow["\square"{description}, draw=none, from=2-1, to=3-2]
	\arrow["g", from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{\beta_1}"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=2-2, to=3-2]
	\arrow["\delta", dashed, from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow[equals, from=2-3, to=3-3]
	\arrow["u", from=2-5, to=2-6]
	\arrow["v", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=2-6, to=2-7]
	\arrow["{p_\gamma v}", from=2-6, to=3-6]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon }", dashed, from=2-7, to=2-8]
	\arrow["{p_\gamma}", from=2-7, to=3-7]
	\arrow["s", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=3-1, to=3-2]
	\arrow["{l_\alpha}", dashed, from=3-1, to=4-1]
	\arrow["t", from=3-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow["{\eta_1}", dashed, from=3-2, to=4-2]
	\arrow["\kappa", dashed, from=3-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow[equals, from=3-6, to=3-7]
	\arrow["{\eta_2}", dashed, from=3-6, to=4-6]
	\arrow["{r_\gamma}", dashed, from=3-7, to=4-7]
\end{tikzcd}.
\end{equation*}

By properties of homotopic squares, $\beta_1$ and $\beta_2$ are both $\mathbb E$-inflations and $\mathbb E$-deflations.

\end{frame}

\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Snake Lemma: Proof Sketch (contd.)}
	By Proposition \ref{prop:hs-inde-ef}, 
		we have homotopic morphisms of $\mathbb E$-conflations $(1;f;s)$, $(f;s;1)$, $(1;t;v)$ and $(t;v;1)$ as follows (dashed arrows indicate extension elements)
\begin{equation*}
	% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&]
	{K_\alpha} \& X \& L \& {C_\alpha} \& {\,} \\
	{K_\alpha} \& Y \& E \& {C_\alpha} \& {\,} \\
	\&\&\& {\,} \\
	{K_\gamma} \& E \& M \& {C_\gamma} \& {\,} \\
	{K_\gamma} \& Z \& N \& {C_\gamma} \& {\,} \\
	\&\&\& {\,}
	\arrow["{i_\alpha}", from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow[equals, from=1-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow["\alpha", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow["f", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{\boxed{\scriptstyle y^\ast r_\alpha}}"{description}, draw=none, from=1-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{p_\alpha}", from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow["s", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{l_\alpha}", dashed, from=1-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["{r_\alpha}", dashed, from=1-4, to=1-5]
	\arrow[equals, from=1-4, to=2-4]
	\arrow["{fi_\alpha}", from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{\beta_1}"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["y", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["{\eta_1}", dashed, from=2-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow["{\mu_1}", dashed, from=2-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow["x", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,88}, from=4-1, to=4-2]
	\arrow[equals, from=4-1, to=5-1]
	\arrow["{\beta_2}"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=4-2, to=4-3]
	\arrow["t", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=4-2, to=5-2]
	\arrow["{\boxed{\scriptstyle x_\ast l_\gamma}}"{description}, draw=none, from=4-2, to=5-3]
	\arrow["{p_\gamma v}", from=4-3, to=4-4]
	\arrow["v", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=4-3, to=5-3]
	\arrow["{\mu_2}", dashed, from=4-3, to=5-4]
	\arrow["{\eta_2}", dashed, from=4-4, to=4-5]
	\arrow[equals, from=4-4, to=5-4]
	\arrow["{i_\gamma}", from=5-1, to=5-2]
	\arrow["\gamma", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,99;blue,255}, from=5-2, to=5-3]
	\arrow["{p_\gamma}", from=5-3, to=5-4]
	\arrow["{l_\gamma}", dashed, from=5-3, to=6-4]
	\arrow["{r_\gamma}", dashed, from=5-4, to=5-5]
\end{tikzcd}.
\end{equation*}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Snake Lemma: Proof Sketch (contd.)}
	The first four terms:
	\begin{equation*}
		% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, row sep = scriptsize, column sep = small]
	{K_\alpha} \& {K_\beta} \& {K_\gamma} \& {\,} \& {K_\beta} \& {K_\gamma} \& {C_\alpha} \& {\,} \\
	{K_\alpha} \& Y \& E \& {\,} \& Y \& E \& {C_\alpha} \& {\,} \\
	\& M \& M \&\& M \& M \\
	\& {\,} \& {\,} \&\& {\,} \& {\,} \\
	{K_\beta} \& {K_\gamma \oplus Y} \& E \& {\,} \& {K_\beta} \& {K_\gamma \oplus Y} \& E \& {\,}
	\arrow["{f'}", from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow[equals, from=1-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow["{g'}", from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow["{i_\beta}", from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["\square"{description}, draw=none, from=1-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{x^\ast \eta_1}", dashed, from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow["x", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,54}, from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{\overline {g'}}", dashed, from=1-5, to=1-6]
	\arrow["{i_\beta}", from=1-5, to=2-5]
	\arrow["\square"{description}, draw=none, from=1-5, to=2-6]
	\arrow["yx", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,54}, dashed, from=1-6, to=1-7]
	\arrow["x", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,54}, from=1-6, to=2-6]
	\arrow["\theta", dashed, from=1-7, to=1-8]
	\arrow[equals, from=1-7, to=2-7]
	\arrow["{i_\beta}", from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{\beta_1}"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,51;green,82;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,51;green,82;blue,255}, from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["\beta", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,82;blue,255}, from=2-2, to=3-2]
	\arrow["{\eta_1}", dashed, from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["{\beta_2}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,82;blue,255}, from=2-3, to=3-3]
	\arrow["{\beta_1}"{inner sep=.8ex}, "\bullet"{marking, text=\pgfkeysvalueof{/tikz/commutative diagrams/background color}}, "\circ"{marking, text={rgb,255:red,51;green,82;blue,255}}, color={rgb,255:red,51;green,82;blue,255}, from=2-5, to=2-6]
	\arrow["\beta", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,82;blue,255}, from=2-5, to=3-5]
	\arrow["y", color={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,54}, from=2-6, to=2-7]
	\arrow["{\beta_2}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,82;blue,255}, from=2-6, to=3-6]
	\arrow["{\mu_1}", dashed, from=2-7, to=2-8]
	\arrow[equals, from=3-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow["{l_\beta}", dashed, from=3-2, to=4-2]
	\arrow["{\mu_2}", dashed, from=3-3, to=4-3]
	\arrow[equals, from=3-5, to=3-6]
	\arrow["{l_\beta}", dashed, from=3-5, to=4-5]
	\arrow["{\mu_2}", dashed, from=3-6, to=4-6]
	\arrow["{\binom {{g'}}{i_\beta}}", from=5-1, to=5-2]
	\arrow["{(x,-\beta_1)}", from=5-2, to=5-3]
	\arrow["{-(\beta_2)^\ast l_\beta}", dashed, from=5-3, to=5-4]
	\arrow["{\binom {\overline {g'}}{i_\beta}}", from=5-5, to=5-6]
	\arrow["{(x,-\beta_1)}", from=5-6, to=5-7]
	\arrow["{-(\beta_2)^\ast l_\beta}", dashed, from=5-7, to=5-8]
\end{tikzcd}.
	\end{equation*}
	By our construction of good completion, we can take $\overline {g'} = g'$ as long as the extension element of $\square$ coincides.
	\begin{itemize}
		\item $K_\gamma \xrightarrow{x} E \xrightarrow{y} C_\alpha$ is the connecting morphism.
	\end{itemize}
	We omit the verification of the remaining terms.
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Snake Lemma (Special cases)}

	\begin{proposition}
		Let $s(\alpha) \xrightarrow{\alpha}t(\alpha)$ and $s(\gamma) \xrightarrow{\gamma}t(\gamma)$ be both $\mathbb E$-inflations and $\mathbb E$-deflations. For any identity $\alpha_\ast \delta = \gamma^\ast$, there is a diagram
		\begin{equation*}
			% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, sep = scriptsize]
	\&\&\& {s(\gamma)} \& {t(\gamma)} \\
	{K_\alpha} \& {K_\beta} \& {K_\gamma} \& {C_\alpha} \& {C_\beta} \& {C_\gamma} \\
	\& {s(\alpha)} \& {t(\alpha)}
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,29;green,158;blue,0}, from=1-4, to=1-5]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,29;green,158;blue,0}, curve={height=-12pt}, from=1-5, to=2-6]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,51;green,58;blue,255}, from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,71}, curve={height=12pt}, from=2-1, to=3-2]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,51;green,58;blue,255}, from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,29;green,158;blue,0}, curve={height=-12pt}, from=2-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,51;green,58;blue,255}, from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,51;green,58;blue,255}, from=2-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,51;green,58;blue,255}, from=2-5, to=2-6]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,71}, from=3-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,255;green,51;blue,71}, curve={height=12pt}, from=3-3, to=2-4]
\end{tikzcd}.
		\end{equation*}
	\end{proposition}
	where any two consecutive morphisms with the same colour forms an $\mathbb E$-conflation.
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Snake Lemma (Special cases)}
	\begin{proposition}
		Suppose $\beta f = u \alpha$, where $f$ and $u$ are $\mathbb E$-inflations, and $\alpha$ and $\beta$ are both $\mathbb E$-inflations and $\mathbb E$-deflations. \textcolor{red}{Assume WIC}, there exists some $\gamma$ which is both an $\mathbb E$-inflation and an $\mathbb E$-deflation making the diagram below commute:
\begin{equation*}
	% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, column sep = scriptsize, row sep = small]
	\& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\alpha}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\beta}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\gamma}} \& {\,} \\
	\& X \& Y \& Z \& {\,} \\
	\& L \& M \& N \& {\,} \\
	{\,} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\alpha}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\beta}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\gamma}}
	\arrow["{f'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow[from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{g'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow[from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, no head, from=1-4, to=1-5]
	\arrow[from=1-4, to=2-4]
	\arrow["f", from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["\alpha", from=2-2, to=3-2]
	\arrow["\circlearrowright"{description}, draw=none, from=2-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow["g", from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["\beta", from=2-3, to=3-3]
	\arrow["\delta", dashed, from=2-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow["\gamma", dashed, from=2-4, to=3-4]
	\arrow["u", from=3-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow[from=3-2, to=4-2]
	\arrow["v", from=3-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow[from=3-3, to=4-3]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon }", dashed, from=3-4, to=3-5]
	\arrow[from=3-4, to=4-4]
	\arrow["z", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-1, to=4-2]
	\arrow["{u'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-2, to=4-3]
	\arrow["{v'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-3, to=4-4]
\end{tikzcd}.
\end{equation*}
		Any two consecutive morphisms as follows form an $\mathbb E$-conflation:
		\begin{equation*}
			K_\alpha \xrightarrow{f'} K_\beta \xrightarrow{g'} K_\gamma \xrightarrow{z} C_\alpha \xrightarrow{u'} C_\beta \xrightarrow{v'} C_\gamma.
		\end{equation*}
	\end{proposition}
\end{frame}


\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Snake Lemma (Special cases)}
	\begin{proposition}
		Suppose $\beta f = u \alpha$, where $f$ and $u$ are $\mathbb E$-inflations, and $\alpha$ and $\beta$ are both $\mathbb E$-inflations and $\mathbb E$-deflations. There exists some $\mathbb E$-deflation $\gamma$ making the diagram below commute:
		\begin{equation*}
			% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, row sep = small, column sep=scriptsize]
	\& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\alpha}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\beta}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\gamma}} \& {\,} \\
	\& X \& Y \& Z \& {\,} \\
	\& L \& M \& N \& {\,} \\
	{\,} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\alpha}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\beta}}
	\arrow["{f'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow[from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{g'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow[from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow[color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, no head, from=1-4, to=1-5]
	\arrow[from=1-4, to=2-4]
	\arrow["f", from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["\alpha", from=2-2, to=3-2]
	\arrow["\circlearrowright"{description}, draw=none, from=2-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow["g", from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["\beta", from=2-3, to=3-3]
	\arrow["\delta", dashed, from=2-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow["\gamma", dashed, from=2-4, to=3-4]
	\arrow["u", from=3-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow[from=3-2, to=4-2]
	\arrow["v", from=3-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow[from=3-3, to=4-3]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon }", dashed, from=3-4, to=3-5]
	\arrow["z", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-1, to=4-2]
	\arrow["{u'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-2, to=4-3]
\end{tikzcd}.
		\end{equation*}
		Any two consecutive morphisms as follows form an $\mathbb E$-conflation:
		\begin{equation*}
			K_\alpha \xrightarrow{f'} K_\beta \xrightarrow{g'} K_\gamma \xrightarrow{z} C_\alpha \xrightarrow{u'} C_\beta.
		\end{equation*}
	\end{proposition}
\end{frame}

	% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, sep =scriptsize]
	\& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\alpha}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\beta}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\gamma}} \& {\,} \\
	\& X \& Y \& Z \& {\,} \\
	\& L \& M \& N \& {\,} \\
	{\,} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\alpha}}
	\arrow["{f'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow[from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{g'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow[from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, no head, from=1-4, to=1-5]
	\arrow[from=1-4, to=2-4]
	\arrow["f", from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["\alpha", dashed, from=2-2, to=3-2]
	\arrow["g", from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["\beta", from=2-3, to=3-3]
	\arrow["\circlearrowright"{description}, draw=none, from=2-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow["\delta", dashed, from=2-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow["\gamma", from=2-4, to=3-4]
	\arrow["u", from=3-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow[from=3-2, to=4-2]
	\arrow["v", from=3-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon }", dashed, from=3-4, to=3-5]
	\arrow["z", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-1, to=4-2]
\end{tikzcd}.
\end{equation*}
		Any two consecutive morphisms as follows form an $\mathbb E$-conflation:
		\begin{equation*}
			K_\alpha \xrightarrow{f'}K_\beta \xrightarrow{g'} K_\gamma \xrightarrow{z} C_\alpha.
		\end{equation*}
	\end{proposition}
\end{frame}




\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Snake Lemma (Special cases)}
	\begin{proposition}
		Suppose $\beta f = u \alpha$, where $f$ and $u$ are $\mathbb E$-inflations. $\gamma$ is an $\mathbb E$-inflation. $\beta$ is both an $\mathbb E$-inflation and an $\mathbb E$-deflation. \textcolor{red}{Assume WIC}, $\alpha$, $\beta$, and $\gamma$ are both $\mathbb E$-inflations and $\mathbb E$-deflations making the diagram below commute:
\begin{equation*}
	% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, column sep = scriptsize, row sep = small]
	\& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\alpha}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\beta}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\gamma}} \& {\,} \\
	\& X \& Y \& Z \& {\,} \\
	\& L \& M \& N \& {\,} \\
	{\,} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\alpha}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\beta}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\gamma}}
	\arrow["{f'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow[from=1-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{g'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=1-3, to=1-4]
	\arrow[from=1-3, to=2-3]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, no head, from=1-4, to=1-5]
	\arrow[from=1-4, to=2-4]
	\arrow["f", from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["\alpha", dashed, from=2-2, to=3-2]
	\arrow["g", from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["\beta", from=2-3, to=3-3]
	\arrow["\circlearrowright"{description}, draw=none, from=2-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow["\delta", dashed, from=2-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow["\gamma", from=2-4, to=3-4]
	\arrow["u", from=3-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow[from=3-2, to=4-2]
	\arrow["v", from=3-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow[from=3-3, to=4-3]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon }", dashed, from=3-4, to=3-5]
	\arrow[from=3-4, to=4-4]
	\arrow["z", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-1, to=4-2]
	\arrow["{u'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-2, to=4-3]
	\arrow["{v'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-3, to=4-4]
\end{tikzcd}.
\end{equation*}
		Any two consecutive morphisms as follows form an $\mathbb E$-conflation:
		\begin{equation*}
			K_\alpha \xrightarrow{f'} K_\beta \xrightarrow{g'} K_\gamma \xrightarrow{z} C_\alpha \xrightarrow{u'} C_\beta \xrightarrow{v'} C_\gamma.
		\end{equation*}
	\end{proposition}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Snake Lemma (Special cases)}
	\begin{proposition}
		Suppose $\beta f = u \alpha$, where $f$ and $u$ are $\mathbb E$-inflations. $\gamma$ is an $\mathbb E$-inflation. $\beta$ is an $\mathbb E$-deflation. \textcolor{red}{Assume WIC}, there exists some $\mathbb E$-deflation $\alpha$ making the diagram below commute:
\begin{equation*}
	% https://q.uiver.app/#

	\end{proposition}

\begin{frame}
	\frametitle{Snake Lemma (Special cases)}
	\begin{proposition}
		Suppose $\beta f = u \alpha$, where $f$ and $u$ are $\mathbb E$-inflations. $\beta$ is an $\mathbb E$-inflation. $\gamma$ is an $\mathbb E$-deflation. There exists some $\mathbb E$-inflation $\alpha$ making the diagram below commute:
\begin{equation*}
	% https://q.uiver.app/#
\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&, sep =scriptsize]
	\&\&\& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{K_\gamma}} \& {\,} \\
	\& X \& Y \& Z \& {\,} \\
	\& L \& M \& N \& {\,} \\
	{\,} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\alpha}} \& \textcolor{rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}{{C_\beta}}
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, no head, from=1-4, to=1-5]
	\arrow[from=1-4, to=2-4]
	\arrow["f", from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["\alpha", dashed, from=2-2, to=3-2]
	\arrow["g", from=2-3, to=2-4]
	\arrow["\beta", from=2-3, to=3-3]
	\arrow["\circlearrowright"{description}, draw=none, from=2-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow["\delta", dashed, from=2-4, to=2-5]
	\arrow["\gamma", from=2-4, to=3-4]
	\arrow["u", from=3-2, to=3-3]
	\arrow[from=3-2, to=4-2]
	\arrow["v", from=3-3, to=3-4]
	\arrow[from=3-3, to=4-3]
	\arrow["{\varepsilon }", dashed, from=3-4, to=3-5]
	\arrow["z", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-1, to=4-2]
	\arrow["{u'}", color={rgb,255:red,51;green,65;blue,255}, from=4-2, to=4-3]
\end{tikzcd}
\end{equation*}
		Moreover, there exists an $\mathbb E$-conflation: $K_\gamma \xrightarrow{z} C_\alpha \xrightarrow{u'}C_\beta$.
	\end{proposition}
\end{frame}
